pullsbody:
This test has been passing since at least 11-Jul-2015. Let's mark it as expected to pass, and revisit if the original issue returns. Pinging @krupa for review.

See [bug 1157317](https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1157317) and [bug 1196162](https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1196162) for more details.

pulltitle: Update marketplace-tests-gaia to use FxAPom 1.4
pullsbody:
@davehunt This update is pretty much the same simple change as was needed in https://github.com/mozilla/marketplace-tests/pull/701, but there are more changes because:
1. We don't have pytest fixtures, so we are creating the account in each test.
2. This code was still using fxapom 1.2, so it was still using the `base_url` so that needed to be changed as well.

As with the other PR, this needs to wait for fxapom 1.4 to be released, and I'll wait on that until you've had a chance to look over this PR as well.
pull_repo_desc: Marketplace UI tests for Firefox OS
pull_commit_message: Update marketplace-tests-gaia to use FxAPom 1.4

pulltitle: Add informative failure message to wait_for_notification_message
pullsbody:
We are still seeing some failures where `wait_for_notification_message` is timing out, and it doesn't really make much sense. I checked one recent failure [1], and, looking at the html source that was captured when the test failed, I do see the expected message in the markup [2](which is from [3]), so I'm not sure why the wait timed out.

This PR will allow us to have a more explicit failure message, which I hope will help us to figure out what is happening.

[1] http://jenkins1.qa.scl3.mozilla.com/view/Marketplace/job/flame-kk-319.mozilla-b2g32_v2_0.nightly.ui.marketplace/262/testReport/junit/test_marketplace_add_review/TestMarketplaceAddReview/test_add_review/
[2] https://gist.github.com/bobsilverberg/18ad764bd385603ac883#file-gistfile1-html-L1133
[3] http://jenkins1.qa.scl3.mozilla.com/view/Marketplace/job/flame-kk-319.mozilla-b2g32_v2_0.nightly.ui.marketplace/262/HTML_Report/
pull_repo_desc: Marketplace UI tests for Firefox OS
pull_commit_message: Change wait_for_notification_message to check the innerHTML of the notification element

pulltitle: Refactor tests to make page flow more explicit and to add waits for pages to be ready
pullsbody:
After experimenting and talking to a marketplace dev, it seems to make sense to introduce waits for each page, so that we can know when the page has finished loading.

I also took this opportunity to address the inconsistent casing used for variable names.

There is more refactoring to be done. There are a number of opportunities to reduce code duplication, but I would like to get this in first to see if it improves the intermittent failures that seem to plague us on CI.

Note that some tests which are currently failing will continue to fail with this PR until they are explicitly fixed. Those are:
`test_make_an_in_app_payment`
`test_marketplace_sign_in_and_sign_out_from_my_apps`
`test_not_you_link_in_app_payment`

@davehunt r?
pull_repo_desc: Marketplace UI tests for Firefox OS
pull_commit_message: Refactor tests to make page flow more explicit and to waits for pages to be ready

pulltitle: Experiment with fixing the PIN continue button issue
pullsbody:
As per our discussion in IRC, @davehunt, I tried to implement a similar solution to the one we used for Login for the fact that we often fail to click on the PIN "Continue" or "Submit" button after entering the PIN. 

As you will see in the attached diff, I removed the previous code which did:
`Wait(marionette=self.marionette).until(lambda m: button.is_enabled())`

and replaced it with a sequence that waits for the element to be present, then displayed, then enabled, and then scrolls it into view.

When I did that, without the sleep at line 87, it _never_ works. The tap _always_ fails, whereas with the old code it only fails sometimes. With the added sleep it always seems to work.

This suggests to me that the old code was taking a bit longer to execute than the new code, which is why it worked sometimes. It was like a sleep. I am a bit surprised that the old code takes longer to execute than the new code, as it's essentially doing the same thing (it's doing even less, in fact), but I guess the way each method is implemented in Marionette is different.

So right now the only working solution I have is the `sleep`. Do you have any other suggestions for better things to do/wait for in this case?

To reproduce, run https://github.com/mozilla/marketplace-tests-gaia/blob/master/marketplacetests/tests/test_marketplace_create_confirm_pin.py
pull_repo_desc: Marketplace UI tests for Firefox OS
pull_commit_message: Use the on screen keyboard to enter the PIN which seems to fix the button tapping issue

pulltitle: Improve the wait and add scrollIntoView to address login failures
pullsbody:
I hate to do this, but adding a sleep before tapping the sign in button seems to be the only way to reliably tap on the button for now.

This is yet another example of a `tap` failing silently. I have tried all kinds of waits and conditions, but none of them seem to allow the tap on the sign in button to work reliably.

Sorry to bother you again, @davehunt, but if you can r? this when you have a chance it would be appreciated.
pull_repo_desc: Marketplace UI tests for Firefox OS
pull_commit_message: Improve the wait and add scrollIntoView to address login failures

pulltitle: Use first popular app, rather than SoundCloud
pullsbody:
There have been tests which are failing because SoundCloud is not found.
While this may be due to a different issue, it seems a better approach to
use an app we know can currently be found, rather than one we assume
can be found.

Note that I sent an email to the mailing list about this, so we should hold off on merging this until @krupa gives us an answer.

A review would still be appreciated. :)
pull_repo_desc: Marketplace UI tests for Firefox OS
pull_commit_message:
Use first popular app, rather than SoundCloud

There have been tests which are failing because SoundCloud is not found.
While this may be due to a different issue, it seems a better approach to
use an app we know can currently be found, rather than one we assume
can be found.

pulltitle: Pin screen
pullsbody:
These changes build on those in PR #65 and are trying to get Payments working again, so only the 2nd commit is relevant. I am able to get through the "Create PIN" screen, but cannot seem to automate the "Confirm PIN" screen, which is quite strange.

What seems to be happening is that when the "Continue" button is tapped, taking us to the Confirm screen, they keyboard goes away and I cannot seem to make it come back no matter what elements I tap on the screen via Marionette.

I need to abandon this for now, but hopefully @AndreiH, perhaps with some help from @davehunt, will be able to get past this issue which will bring us very close to having payment testing reenabled.
pull_repo_desc: Marketplace UI tests for Firefox OS
pull_commit_message: Enable more tests by creating an FxA for each test

pulltitle: Launch Marketplace via the app icon instead of via Javascript
pullsbody:
This is an alternative to PR #10. The code is much simpler, but it will take a bit longer to execute as it has to scroll through homescreen pages.

I also took this opportunity to do a bit of refactoring with the Marketplace app name, which was unnecessarily being set all over the place. It can still be overridden in an individual test, but doesn't need to be set for every test.

Tbh, this is probably a better approach than PR #10, unless there is a specific reason that we'd rather not launch the app via the icon.
pull_repo_desc: Marketplace UI tests for Firefox OS
pull_commit_message:
Launch Marketplace via the app icon instead of via Javascript
Refactor app name variables
Remove explicit switch_to_frame calls and unneeded launch calls

pulltitle: Bug 958123 - [marketplace-tests-gaia] Override the launch method in GaiaApps to ignore pesky Javascript errors
pullsbody:
There have been a lot of errors on `b2g.hamachi.mozilla-aurora.marketplace`, most of which have been a JavascriptException that is thrown during the launch of the Marketplace app, which Marionette then catches and causes the launch to fail. This is a non-critical JS exception, but it causes the test to fail.

A sample stack trace is:

```
test_marketplace_feedback_user (test_marketplace_feedback_login.TestMarketplaceFeedback) ... ERROR

======================================================================
ERROR: None
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/var/jenkins/workspace/b2g.hamachi.mozilla-aurora.marketplace/.env/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/marionette_client-0.7.1-py2.7.egg/marionette/marionette_test.py", line 143, in run
    testMethod()
  File "/var/jenkins/workspace/b2g.hamachi.mozilla-aurora.marketplace/marketplacetests/tests/test_marketplace_feedback_login.py", line 24, in test_marketplace_feedback_user
    self.marketplace.launch()
  File "/var/jenkins/workspace/b2g.hamachi.mozilla-aurora.marketplace/marketplacetests/marketplace/app.py", line 48, in launch
    Base.launch(self, launch_timeout=120000)
  File "/var/jenkins/workspace/b2g.hamachi.mozilla-aurora.marketplace/.env/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/gaiatest-0.21.2-py2.7.egg/gaiatest/apps/base.py", line 26, in launch
    self.app = self.apps.launch(self.name, launch_timeout=launch_timeout)
  File "/var/jenkins/workspace/b2g.hamachi.mozilla-aurora.marketplace/.env/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/gaiatest-0.21.2-py2.7.egg/gaiatest/gaia_test.py", line 75, in launch
    result = self.marionette.execute_async_script("GaiaApps.launchWithName('%s')" % name, script_timeout=launch_timeout)
  File "/var/jenkins/workspace/b2g.hamachi.mozilla-aurora.marketplace/.env/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/marionette_client-0.7.1-py2.7.egg/marionette/marionette.py", line 1073, in execute_async_script
    filename=os.path.basename(frame[0]))
  File "/var/jenkins/workspace/b2g.hamachi.mozilla-aurora.marketplace/.env/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/marionette_client-0.7.1-py2.7.egg/marionette/marionette.py", line 577, in _send_message
    self._handle_error(response)
  File "/var/jenkins/workspace/b2g.hamachi.mozilla-aurora.marketplace/.env/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/marionette_client-0.7.1-py2.7.egg/marionette/marionette.py", line 612, in _handle_error
    raise JavascriptException(message=message, status=status, stacktrace=stacktrace)
JavascriptException: TypeError: widgetFrame is null
    stacktrace:
    @app://system.gaiamobile.org/js/cost_control.js, line 70
TEST-UNEXPECTED-FAIL | test_marketplace_feedback_login.py test_marketplace_feedback_login.TestMarketplaceFeedback.test_marketplace_feedback_user | 
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Ran 1 test in 74.436s

FAILED (errors=1)
```

We saw something similar in the gaia-ui-tests job awhile back and had to wait for a developer to address it.

Because this repo is small and focussed on testing Marketplace functionality, as opposed to general gaia reliability, it was suggested that maybe we should just ignore these errors. I believe that Bebe proposed a similar approach at the time and it wasn't favoured, but I discussed this with Zac on IRC and we thought it might be appropriate for this repo.

Hence, I bring you this pull request. It is a bit ugly as I had to override the launch method in `GaiaApps`, but the plus side is that, if we do decide to accept this patch, we now have a template going forward for any other times we need to customize the behaviour of gaiatest for this repo.

I'm not convinced that this is the best approach, and I'm going to try something simpler as well, and probably submit that as a second PR, so I am interested in people's feedback on this.

Pinging @zacc @davehunt @bebef1987 for feedback.
pull_repo_desc: Marketplace UI tests for Firefox OS
pull_commit_message: Override the launch method in marketplace.app to ignore pesky Javascript errors
